result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sydnee L. Meland

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
PLEAS for 10/31/22 adjourned to 11/21/22 at 8:30 am on court's motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date.  Confirming email sent to parties.

9:42 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sydnee L. Meland in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M. Gardner in court for Sydnee L. Meland. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM823/22CM1163. Attorney Gardner is requesting an adjournment as she was just appointed on the DE's new case and needs to request/review the discovery. Attorney Gardner states the matter should be resolved by the next hearing and is requesting a plea/sentencing date. The State does not object.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.

143PM    State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Alyssah Foster with intern Darryl Watts.   The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am. $250  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). ec
